questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a common source of caffeine?
Which medical name is caffeine known by?
What item contains more caffeine than the others?
questions.explanation:
a 6 oz. cup of coffee

	The coffee has 100 mg. The Coke has 50 mg., the chocolate contains 24 mg., and the Anacin contains 64 mg.

questions.text: What chemical in your body does caffeine NOT affect?
questions.explanation:
nitrogen (N2).

	It is a diuretic, so your kidneys remove more water. It makes your body think there's an emergency, so adrenalin increases. It also slows dopamine up-take, increasing activity in the pleasure center of the brain. This may explain its addictive qualities.

questions.text: What percentage of Americans consume caffeine daily?
Caffeine is classified as what kind of drug?
Caffeine is only available to the public in food; i.e., you need a prescription to get pure caffeine.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Besides being in headache medicines, it's also available in 100 mg. tablets, most notably the brand No-Doz.

questions.text: Root beer is one soft drink that usually doesn't have caffeine. What brand DOES have caffeine in it?
What is the chemical formula for caffeine?
questions.explanation:
C8 H10 N4 O2.

	The other compounds are: (CH3)2: {ethane;} CH3 CH2 OH: ethyl (drinking) {alcohol;} C6 H12 O6: glucose (a sugar).
